intro: Conopodium brachycarpum var. pusillum, commonly known as the dwarf bladderwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the Lentibulariaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, floating leaves and specialized structures called bladders, which it uses to trap small aquatic organisms. This plant is typically found in still or slow-moving freshwater habitats, such as ponds and ditches. It thrives in nutrient-rich environments and is often associated with muddy substrates. Its unique morphology and carnivorous adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
